questions.question: What is the overall shape of the presented nutrition facts panel, considering its rectangular borders and content layout?

What is the font style used for the header 'Nutrition Facts', taking into account its weight and appearance?
What is the primary material that the nutrition facts panel appears to be printed on, based on its visual properties?
What is the text size of the main nutritional value categories (e.g., Total Fat, Sodium) compared to the specific values shown?
What is the alignment of the nutritional values listed in the right-hand column concerning their corresponding categories?
Is there a visible border around the nutrition facts panel, and if so, what is its color?
Considering the layout, what is the overall organization style of the nutritional information, such as tabular or paragraph?
What is the visual weight given to the 'Serving Size' and 'Servings Per Container' information compared to other data?
What is the apparent texture of the surface on which the nutrition facts are printed based on the image quality?
Do any specific nutritional values stand out visually due to size, highlighting or boldness, compared to others?

What is the overall visual density of the nutrition facts panel, considering text and spacing, qualifying it as sparse, medium or high?
